projects.title: NullID
projects.description: Privacy-focused communication and security project with strong access control and operational reliability principles.
projects.problem: Authentication and secure collaboration were fragmented across tools, making incident response noisy and audit trails weak.
projects.role: Designed the baseline hardening model, access-control boundaries, and operational runbooks while implementing the deployment workflow.
architecture: Hardened Linux host with strict SSH and service boundaries
Reverse-proxy ingress layer with controlled upstream exposure
Audit-friendly logging and alerting pipeline for suspicious events
projects.outcome: Delivered a secure-by-default platform baseline that reduced authentication noise and made operational triage faster and more predictable.

impactMetrics.label: reduction in failed SSH authentication noise after hardening
faster suspicious-session triage with centralized logs
privileged access moved to least-privilege role profiles

projects.title: NullCal
projects.description: Scheduling and planning automation built to reduce repetitive coordination work and improve execution consistency.
projects.problem: Planning and follow-up work depended on manual reminders, causing deadline drift and inconsistent execution.
projects.role: Built scheduling automation flows, reminder orchestration, and operational guardrails to keep planning predictable.
architecture: Event-driven scheduling layer for recurring checkpoints
Task-state persistence with deterministic retry-safe updates
Notification and reporting hooks for planning visibility
projects.outcome: Converted manual coordination into an automation-assisted routine that improved consistency and reduced follow-up overhead.

impactMetrics.label: less manual coordination work during weekly planning
average weekly time saved via automation workflows
critical sprint checkpoints missed in simulated releases

projects.title: PacMan
projects.description: Classic arcade-style PacMan implementation focused on gameplay logic, responsive controls, and clean front-end structure.
projects.problem: The goal was to recreate classic arcade behavior with modern responsiveness while keeping code modular and maintainable.
projects.role: Implemented core gameplay logic, rendering loops, input handling, and responsive layout behavior across viewport sizes.
architecture: State-driven game loop for deterministic gameplay updates
Collision and scoring modules decoupled from rendering logic
Responsive UI layer for desktop and mobile controls
projects.outcome: Released a polished browser-based game that balances nostalgic interaction patterns with modern frontend structure.

impactMetrics.label: stable gameplay rendering target on desktop browsers
median input-to-response latency under normal load
core game mechanics covered in functional playtest checklist
